revised_title: Associative Desorption in Adlayers of Interacting Particles: Nitric Oxide on Pt, Ni, and Ru
tldr: The authors examine the kinetics of associative desorption from mixed adlayers containing nitric oxide (NO) and other particles on platinum (Pt), nickel (Ni), and ruthenium (Ru) surfaces. They use statistical mechanical methods to study the effects of lateral interactions between near-neighbour particles on the desorption kinetics while the adlayer stoichiometry varies continuously during a desorption sweep. The study provides insights into the desorption behavior of nitric oxide adlayers on transition metal surfaces, which is important for understanding the underlying processes in observed spectra.
